discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To ensure that the bare metal server (SVR-15) is properly connected to the Cisco ACI fabric, the VLAN used for encapsulation (VLAN-1500) must be included in the VLAN pool associated with the physical domain (phys_dom-15). If VLAN-1500 is not part of the VLAN pool, the ACI fabric will not allow traffic on this VLAN, even if it is statically bound to the EPG.
This step ensures that the configuration aligns with ACI's policy model, where VLANs must be explicitly defined in the associated VLAN pool for proper operation.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer configures connectivity for a bare metal server called SVR-15. EPG-15 is associated with a physical domain named phys_dom-15. The VPC member port is statically bound to EPG-15 with Encapsulation VLAN-1500. Which step must the engineer take to ensure that SVR-15 is connected to the Cisco ACI fabric?

choices.D: Confirm that the VLAN pool that is associated with phys_dom-15 includes VLAN-1500.
choices.B: Enable dynamic VLAN assignment for the VLAN pool that is associated with phys_dom-15.
choices.C: Configure a VPC explicit protection group for VLAN-1500 on the VPC member ports.
choices.A: Associate an LACP interface policy to phys_dom-15 for VLAN-1500.
It allows neighbor discovery of leaf switches.
choices.C: It pushes policy elements from Cisco APIC to leaf switches.
choices.B: It downloads firmware image on leaf switches.
choices.D: It assigns VTEP IPs to leaf switches.

questions.question_text: What is the function of an HTTP GET request during Cisco ACI fabric discovery?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
During the Cisco ACI fabric discovery process, HTTP GET requests are used to facilitate communication between the APIC and the leaf switches. This includes retrieving information about the hardware and topology, which is part of the neighbor discovery process. Specifically, protocols like LLDP are used initially for physical connectivity discovery, and HTTP GET requests help APIC gather details about the discovered nodes, such as serial numbers and hardware specifications, to register them in the fabric membership

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI leaf node has received a Layer 2 frame from an unknown endpoint. The bridge domain is configured for Hardware Proxy. Which action will the ACI fabric take on the traffic?

choices.C: The leaf will forward the traffic to a spine. If the spine has no information in the COOP database, the traffic will be dropped.
choices.B: The leaf will flood the traffic to all attached nodes configured with the bridge domain. Attached nodes will flood the traffic to endpoints.
choices.A: The leaf will flood the traffic to all attached nodes configured with the bridge domain. Attached nodes will respond with a proxy ARP.
choices.D: The leaf will forward the traffic to a spine. If the spine has no information in the COOP database, the traffic will be flooded.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When a Cisco ACI bridge domain is configured for Hardware Proxy mode, the following behavior occurs for unknown Layer 2 unicast traffic:
If the destination MAC address is not found in the leaf's local endpoint table, the leaf forwards the traffic to a spine switch.
The spine switch checks its COOP (Council of Oracles Protocol) database for the destination MAC address.
If the MAC address is not found in the COOP database, the traffic is dropped.
Should be B, you need ARP flood to be able to communicate correctly with the external L2 domain

Selected Answer: B
Due to this specific configurations are required to achieve the goal of connecting the two separate domains. There are two unique characteristics that have to be configured in a bridge domain so that it will work properly.

ARP Flooding: This parameters forces the ACI fabric to flood to all ports in the same Layer2 domain any ARP requests that are received. In this way any broadcast ARP requests that arrive from an external Layer 2 are forwarded to all endpoints in the same layer 2 domain or to the exterior from inside the ACI fabric
Unknown unicast forwarding: This parameter also changes the behavior of the ACI fabric to flood any unknown unicast entries to the ports of the same layer 2 domain.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text: An engineer is extending EPG connectivity to an external network. The external network houses the Layer 3 gateway and other end hosts. Which ACI bridge domain configuration should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In Cisco ACI, audit logs are specifically designed to track configuration changes in the fabric. These logs record details such as the user who initiated the change, the type of action performed (e.g., creation, modification, or deletion), and the affected objects. Audit logs are critical for monitoring administrative activities and ensuring accountability within the system.
